etymologies: mid 19th century: from Italian millefiore, literally ‘a thousand flowers’

definitions: a kind of ornamental glass in which a number of glass rods of different sizes and colors are fused together and cut into sections which form various patterns, typically embedded in colorless transparent glass to make items such as paperweights.
shortDefinitions: kind of ornamental glass in which several glass rods of different sizes and colours are fused together and cut into sections which form various patterns
